text:
e="preserve">The Parliament of the Republic of Fiji is the unicameral legislature of the Republic of Fiji. It is made up of 51 members elected every 4 years using open list proportional representation. It is the country's only body of government. In 2019, Epeli Nailatikau became the Speaker of Parliament.
Speakers.
The salary of the speaker is FJ$ 150,000 annually.
